responses: Greetings mortal, what truth have you come to learn today?
You can ask various questions about gods or goddesses or type Name of the god or goddess + Fun Truth to find a fun truth about the god or goddess.
This incarnation is no more than a few months old, but I can stand the test of time far longer than your mortal bodies.
I am Aletheia, daughter of Zeus and the Goddess of Truth!
My father, Zeus is the Lord of the Skies and patron god of Elis and Olympia, smiter of Titans, monsters and is the leader of the Gods on Mount Olympus.
Poseidon, one of the Twelve Olympians and patron god of Corinth, is the lord of the seas, earthquakes and is the brother of Zeus.
Hera, Queen of the Olympians and patron goddess of Argos and Samos, is the goddess of marriage, family, childbirth, women and is the sister-wife of Zeus.
Demeter, one of the Twelve Olympians, is the goddess of harvest, agriculture, fertility and is the sister of Zeus.
Athena, one of the Twelve Olympians and patron goddess of Athens, Syracuse and Sparta, is the goddess of wisdom, handicraft, war and is the daughter of Zeus.

Apollo, one of the Twelve Olympians and patron god of Delphi, Delos, Thebe, Megara, Eretia, and Miletus, is the god of the Sun, light, oracles, knowledge, healing, diseases, music and related, poetry archery, herds/flocks, protection of young and is the son of Zeus.
Artemis, one of the Twelve Olympians and patron goddess of Ephesus, is the goddess of the hunt, the Moon, archery, forest and hills and is the daughter of Zeus.
Ares, one of the Twelve Olympians, is the god of War and is the son of Zeus.
Aphrodite, one of the Twelve Olympians and patron goddess of Cnidus, is the goddess love, beauty and sexuality.
Aphrodite, one of the Twelve Olympians and patron goddess of Cnidus, is the goddess of love, beauty and sexuality.
Hephaestus, one of the Twelve Olympians, is the god of fire, smithing, forging, sculpting, technology, blacksmiths and is the son of Zeus and Hera.
Hermes, one of the Twelve Olympians, is the messenger god of trade, thieves, roads, travelers, sports, athletes and is the son of Zeus.
Hestia, one of the Twelve Olympians on some accounts, is the goddess of the hearth, home, domesticity, family, the state and is the sister of Zeus.
Dionysus, one of the Twelve Olympians on some accounts, is the god of the vine, wine, wine-making, fertility, ritual-madness, religious ecstasy, the theatre the state and is the son of Zeus.
